main event: A metallic object, approximately 3 feet in diameter and 8 inches thick, was discovered in Wayne, Michigan on November 6, 1957. It appeared to have fallen from the sky and crashed through the roof of a detached garage.
interesting points: Local police were notified of the discovery of the metallic object in a residential area.
The object had a silver-colored metal composition with a rough, crystalline surface texture.
No identifying marks or symbols were visible on the object.
The U.S. Air Force and the Federal Bureau of Investigation dispatched teams to investigate and the object was transported to a secure military facility for further analysis.
Efforts were underway to determine the origin and composition of the recovered object.
witnesses: local police, U.S. Air Force, Federal Bureau of Investigation
